title: AWS re:Invent 2025 - Maximize Productivity with the Amazon Q Developer CLI Agent (DVT223)
title_cn: AWS re:Invent 2025 - 使用 Amazon Q Developer CLI 代理最大化生产力 (DVT223)
abstract: Explore the different ways that the Amazon Q Developer CLI agent can be used to save time and effort when working in the command line. This session delivers practical strategies for anyone aiming to integrate the Amazon Q Developer CLI Agent into their workflows. Learn from real-world examples and demos that showcase how to maximize productivity when interacting with AWS services, using the AWS CLI, and SDKs from the command line. This presentation is brought to you by Pluralsight, an AWS Partner.
abstract_cn:
Amazon Q Developer CLI agent offers several key ways to streamline command-line workflows:

## Quick Command Generation
- Natural language to AWS CLI commands: "create an S3 bucket with versioning enabled"
- Generates proper syntax with required parameters
- Suggests best practices and security configurations

## Interactive Troubleshooting
- Analyzes error messages and suggests fixes
- Explains AWS service limits and quota issues
- Provides alternative approaches when commands fail

## Code and Script Assistance
- Generates infrastructure as code (CloudFormation, CDK, Terraform)
- Creates automation scripts for repetitive tasks
- Reviews and optimizes existing scripts

## Resource Discovery and Management
- Helps find resources across regions and accounts
- Suggests cost optimization opportunities
- Explains service relationships and dependencies

## Learning and Documentation
- Explains AWS service concepts in context
- Provides relevant documentation links
- Suggests related services and features

## Practical Integration Strategies
- Set up aliases for frequently used Q Developer commands
- Use it for code reviews before deployment
- Leverage it for incident response and debugging
- Integrate into CI/CD pipelines for validation

The agent excels at bridging the gap between knowing what you want to accomplish and knowing the exact commands or configurations needed to achieve it, making it particularly valuable for both AWS newcomers and experienced users working with unfamiliar services.
